org.rootsdev.polygenea

Class JSONParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rootsdev.polygenea.JSONParser

  • public class JSONParser
extends java.lang.Object
    A class of static methods for parsing JSON into classes from java.util and java.lang. Contains the ability to request lists be parsed as sets.
    Author:
    Luther Tychonievich. Released into the public domain. I would consider it a courtesy if you cite my contributions to any code derived from this code or project that uses this code.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  JSONParser.JSONOrderer
      A comparator for sorting arbitrary JSON objects, used in forcing lists to be sets.
      static class  JSONParser.ListOrSet
      Used to force lists to be sets.
      static class  JSONParser.MalformedJSONException
      The exception thrown by parsers in this class.

      JSONParser()

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public static java.lang.Object parse(java.io.Reader r,
                                     JSONParser.ListOrSet policy)
        Like parse(Reader) except you can specify that some lists be returned as sorted sets instead
        Parameters:
        r - The reader to parse from
        policy - Whether to convert all, most, some, or no lists into sorted sets
        Returns:
        A Map<String, Object>, List<Object>, SortedSet<Object>, String, Long, Boolean, Double, or null

      • parse

        public static java.lang.Object parse(java.io.Reader r)
        Parses valid JSON and returns the resulting value. If the input is not valid JSON, advances the reader far enough to know that. If the reader supports marks, the end position will be the character after the first JSON value read, or the character at which invalidity was first noticed. Otherwise, the end position may be arbitrarily far after that point as determined by the default BufferedReader's buffering strategy.
        Parameters:
        r - The reader to parse from.
        Returns:
        A Map<String, Object>, List<Object>, String, Long, Boolean, Double, or null
        Throws:
        JSONParser.MalformedJSONException - if the input does not begin with a valid JSON value
